ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: From out of them come glistening pearls and coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: Out of them come pearls and coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: From these seas come forth pearls and coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: From the two oceans comes pearls and coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: Pearls and coral-stone come forth from them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Out of them both come out pearls and Al-Marjan.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: There come forth from them pearls, both large and small.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: From them come forth the pearl and the coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: There cometh forth from both of them the pearl and coral-stone.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Pearls and corals come forth from both of them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: There come forth from the twain the pearl and the coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: From them emerge the pearl and the coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Out of them come Pearls and Coral:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Out of them both come out pearl and coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Pearls and corals come from both.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: From them emerge pearls and coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: From both of them emerge pearl and coral.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [55:22] From [both of] them, from the point at which they [seem to] meet — but which is actually from [only] one of the two, and that is, the salt water — is brought forth (yukhraju, passive, may also be read as active, yakhruju, ‘emerge’) the pearl and the coral (marjān, these are red pieces of shell, or small pearls).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: There cometh forth from both of them) but especially from the salty one (the pearl) big in size (and coral stone) small in size.
